newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Shanghai Ind parent to keep major stake.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai Ind parent to keep major stake.

text.p: Shanghai Industrial Holdings Ltd said on Thursday its parent would not lower its stake in the company below a 50 percent holding.

"When the time is right, the parent company could consider reducing its stake," chairman Cai Laixing told reporters after the company's annual general meeting. "But investors should not worry. We will not consider such action lightly."

Cai said the company's parent, Shanghai Industrial Investment (Holdings) Co Ltd, was not considering reducing its 65.1 percent holding at this time and in any case would not reduce it below 50 percent.
On Tuesday, Shanghai Industrial shares fell sharply to HK$39.00 before recovering to HK$40.40 on market rumours the parent was planning to reduce its stake.
The company issued a statement saying the parent would consider using certain of its assets, including its shareholding in Shanghai Industrial, for various financing arrangements.
Shanghai Industrial shares closed HK$0.10 lower at HK$41.20 on Thursday.
